definition: tree/wood/coffin/wooden/simple/numb/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: The land is covered in shrubs.
Newcomers include Japanese knotweed and Amur bush honeysuckle.
sentences.chinese: 外来物种包括日本紫菀和灌木忍冬。

sentences.english: But be the best little scrub by the side of the rill;
sentences.chinese: 但一定要做溪边最好的一丛小灌木。

sentences.english: However, the species density on shrubby layer would be varied when the slope aspect changes.
sentences.chinese: 坡向对于灌木层物种密度也有一定影响。

sentences.english: He suggests shading plants with bed sheets, shade cloth or brush -- in other words, sticks and branches.
sentences.chinese: 或者用灌木丛，换句话说，也就是枝条。

sentences.english: Jatropha curcas is a non-edible shrub that is native to Central America.
sentences.chinese: 桐油树是一种不可食用的灌木，原产于中美洲。

sentences.english: Deciduous leaf bush or small tree.
Puma fur was found clinging to bushes.
sentences.chinese: 灌木丛中也发现了粘在上面的美洲狮毛。

sentences.english: Volunteers were in the bush all the time and didn't let on.
sentences.chinese: 志愿军战士们一直在灌木丛中，没有暴露目标。

sentences.english: Then, tie them and leave them in the deep woods.
sentences.chinese: 接着，把他们捆上丢进灌木丛深处。

sentences.english: They hid themselves behind some bushed for fear that the enemy should find them.
sentences.chinese: 他们躲在灌木丛后面，以防敌人会发现他们。

sentences.english: She lived in a band under a hedge.
sentences.chinese: 她住在灌木篱笆下面的田埂里。

sentences.english: The sudden noise in the bushes startled her horse.
sentences.chinese: 灌木丛中突然发出的怪声使她的马惊跳起来。

sentences.english: I turned into the dirt road and followed it through encroaching trees and bushes.
sentences.chinese: 我转上土路，在蔓延至路面的树木和灌木间穿行。

sentences.english: Bush fires in Australia leave high levels of black carbon in the soil for hundreds of years.
sentences.chinese: 几百年来灌木燃烧留下了大量黑炭。

sentences.english: TASTING NOTES : Aromas of thyme, rosemary and other herbs typical of the "garrigue"(Mediterranean scrubland) can be detected in the bouquet.
sentences.chinese: 气味带有百里香，迷失香和地中海灌木丛香气。

definition: tree, esp. with recognizable trunk (as opposed to 灌木[guan4 mu4], bush or shrub)
Shulin city in New Taipei City 新北市[Xin1 bei3 shi4], Taiwan
